intro: Heterotoma lobelioides subsp. lobelioides, commonly known as the slender false heather, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in pine forests or along stream banks. It has slender, erect stems and narrow, opposite leaves, and it blooms from late spring to early summer.
